title: Energy Efficiency and Process Optimisation for Process Industries | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This course enables energy managers and plant facility engineers in process and petrochemical industries to identify energy-saving opportunities within their plants.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Energy Efficiency and Process Optimisation for Process Industries
Energy Efficiency and Process Optimisation for Process Industries
This course enables energy managers and plant facility engineers in process and petrochemical industries to identify energy-saving opportunities within their plants.
Process Engineering, Process Safety, Energy Efficiency, Sustainability

Singapore’s industrial sector accounts for about 60% of Singapore’s CO2 emissions. The process and petrochemical subsectors are the leading industrial energy consumers, contributing to the bulk of CO2 emissions.

From the perspectives of corporate ESG responsibility and the economic cost of carbon pricing, it is essential for the industry sector to adopt energy efficiency as a core strategy to reduce emissions while lowering total energy costs and boosting industrial competitiveness. This 5-day course is designed to enable energy managers and plant facility engineers in the process and petrochemical industries to identify energy-saving opportunities within their plants.
Professional engineers with responsibilities for designing or integrating process & facility equipment for the petrochemical industry
In this 5-day course, participants will be able to gain insights on the following:
Review the energy efficiency performance of the facility under their charge
Benchmark energy intensity and carbon footprint reduction
Identify process improvement for energy efficiency
Apply pinch analysis for process improvement and optimum energy usage
Minimise waste and identify energy-saving opportunities for major energy-consuming systems:
Principal Engineer, Energy Systems Management Ltd., and Chair of the Maintenance Engineering Society of New Zealand.
Principal Engineer, Energy Systems Management Ltd., and Chair of the Maintenance Engineering Society of New Zealand.

James has a PhD in Mechanical Engineering from the University of New South Wales and has 26 years’ experience as a professional engineer with expertise in fluid mechanics, thermodynamics, industrial energy efficiency, industrial greenhouse gas emissions reduction, acoustics, and engineering economics in both experimental and numerical modelling applications. He has a wealth of experience in working both in industry and working alongside industrial project partners to deliver successful outcomes that deliver on improved energy efficiency, increased process yields, and enhanced plant and process reliability; with a strong emphasis on realising meaningful gains in Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE). His work has included the establishment and delivery of energy auditor training and accreditation programmes for the New Zealand Industry at a national level for fan, pump, steam, compressed air, and process cooling systems.

After a 16-year stint at the University of Waikato, including the establishment and leadership of the Engineering Energy Research Centre, James is now busy working full-time in the private sector to implement change with a wide range of industry clients and partners. James and his team, work with a strong emphasis on a “total integrated systems engineering approach” to plant and process improvement that incorporates principles of energy efficiency, equipment and process reliability, and process optimisation. James has volunteered extensively both domestically and internationally to better the engineering profession, including over 16 years’ voluntary service on various committees and boards for the Society of Maintenance and Reliability Professionals (SMRP), Vibration Association of New Zealand (VANZ) and the Maintenance Engineering Society of New Zealand (MESNZ). James is the current Chair of the Maintenance Engineering Society of NZ (MESNZ).
Associate Professor/Prog Leader, Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor/Prog Leader, Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Li Chuanzhao received his BEng and MEng from Tianjin University (China), and PhD degree from National University of Singapore (NUS), all in Chemical Engineering. He has worked extensively in industry, R&D and academia. He has 7 years of industry experience as process engineer and project manager in the process development, design, construction and operation of several chemical processes and plants. He has also previously worked in NUS, Institute of Chemical and Engineering Sciences (ICES) and Newcastle University. His research interests lie in process development, simulation and optimization, process engineering and process analytical technology (PAT). He has authored/co-authored more than 50 peer reviewed journal articles and 5 granted/commercialized patents.
Professor, of Process Design and Integration at the University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus and Founding Director for the Centre of Excellence for Green Technologies
Professor, of Process Design and Integration at the University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus and Founding Director for the Centre of Excellence for Green Technologies

Dr. Ir. Dominic Foo is a Professor of Process Design and Integration at the University of Nottingham Malaysia and is the Founding Director of the Centre of Excellence for Green Technologies.  He is a Fellow of the Institution of Chemical Engineers (IChemE), a fellow of the Academy of Sciences Malaysia (ASM), a fellow of the Institution of Engineers Malaysia (IEM), a Chartered Engineer (CEng) with the Engineering Council UK, Professional Engineer (PEng) with the Board of Engineer Malaysia (BEM), ASEAN Chartered Professional Engineers (ACPE), as well as the President for the Asia Pacific Confederation of Chemical Engineering (APCChE).  He is in the top 1% of world-renowned scientist according to Stanford List, working in process integration for resource conservation and CO2 reduction. He collaborates with more than 50 research scholars and industrial practitioners over Asia, Europe, North America and Africa.  Professor Foo is an active author, with eight books, and more than 190 journal papers and made more than 240 conference presentations, with more than 30 keynote/plenary speeches.  He served on International Scientific Committees for many important international conferences (CHISA/PRES, FOCAPD, ESCAPE, PSE, SDEWES, etc.).

Professor Foo is the editor-in-chief for Process Integration and Optimization for Sustainability (Springer Nature), subject editor for Process Safety & Environmental Protection (Elsevier), and editorial board member for several other renowned journals.  He is the winner of the Innovator of the Year Award 2009 of IChemE, Young Engineer Award 2010 of IEM, the Outstanding Young Malaysian Award 2012 of Junior Chamber International (JCI), Outstanding Asian Researcher and Engineer 2013 (Society of Chemical Engineers, Japan), Vice-Chancellor’s Achievement Award 2014 (University of Nottingham) and Top Research Scientist Malaysia 2016 (ASM).  He has conducted more than 100 professional workshops for academics and industrial practitioners worldwide.
Review of energy efficiency performance of the process industry
Energy performance monitoring, KPIs and energy influence variables (EIVs)
Technologies and systems to consider for energy efficiency improvements
Process integration opportunity assessment with retrofit
Fired equipment (furnaces, boilers, kilns, ovens, dryers)
Fans and industrial gaseous flow systems
Workshop on energy audit for the process industry
Identifying process improvements for energy efficiency
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$5,450.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

With the maritime industry turning to lower carbon fuels and energy-efficient technologies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, the Masterclass in Maritime Decarbonisation offered by SIT steers knowledge acquisition in this direction.
Helping SMEs Embed Sustainability in Business

Co-developed with the Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (ASME), the ‘Introduction to Sustainability for Businesses’ course provides companies with the knowledge and frameworks for mapping their sustainability goals.
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.
Embracing Singapore’s new safety case regime

With the regulations for Safety Case Regime kicking in from September 2017, all Major Hazards Installation (MHI) companies will be required to submit a Safety Case to demonstrate how risks from major accident hazards can be reduced to as low as reasonably practicable (ALARP).

Explore elements that contribute to sustainable and resilient data centres, focusing on innovative technologies and strategies that ensure business continuity and minimise downtime during disruptions.
Building Services, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Executive Education
Explore the fundamentals of fire engineering science and its role in analysing fire behaviour, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics in complex built environments.
Graduate Certificate in Fire Dynamics and Fire Modelling
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
CHE6031N01 Process Safety Management and KPIs
Learn about effective Process Safety Management systems and associated performance measurement to ensure safe plant operations.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency
Motor Driven Systems, Audit and Analysis
This course covers energy conservation opportunities for motor-driven equipment, including MDS design, system evaluation, and energy management programmes.
